column2: WEST VIRGINIA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: WV

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column6: try your emergency lights.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 2. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 3. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column6: that a divided highway ends
column8: of a reduction of lanes

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column6: Curve ahead
column8: Wrong Way

column2: 5. This sign means:
column6: You must yield the right-of-way ahead
column8: You must stop ahead

column2: 6. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column6: in school zones.
column8: at most intersections.

column2: 7. When a funeral procession led by a funeral escort vehicle comes to an intersection where you are waiting, you must:
column4: yield the right of way to the procession when the lead car goes through.
column6: cross the intersection when it is your turn.
column8: cross the intersection before the funeral escort vehicle.
column10: let the lead vehicle go through, and then cross the intersection.

column2: 8. Yellow traffic signs:
column6: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: give directional information.

column2: 9. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 10. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your attention away from driving
column6: take your eyes off the road
column8: take your hands off the wheel

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column6: No U-turns
column8: Right turn is not permitted
column10: A left turn can be made only after stopping

column2: 12. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column6: try to pass close behind.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 13. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column6: Crossbuck
column8: Round

column2: 14. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: Proceed with caution
column8: Come to a full stop

column2: 15. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column8: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.

column2: 16. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive in the right lane only.
column6: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: sound their horn to warn other drivers.

column2: 17. This road sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 18. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column6: stop in the right lane.
column8: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column10: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.

column2: 19. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 20. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column6: when making turns.
column8: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 21. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column10: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column6: Stop if necessary
column8: You must make a complete stop

column2: 23. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 24. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column6: You can travel in either direction in this lane
column8: Intersection ahead
